span.p: The VMAX 850F range in size from one up to eight v-Brick/z-Brick systems. A v-Brick for open systems and a z-Brick for mainframe are the basic building blocks that include:

ul.li: An engine (the redundant data storage processing unit) using 12-Core Intel Xeon E5-2650-v2, 2.7 GHz CPUs
A starter capacity of 53Tbu of flash drives distributed across two dense Disk Array Enclosures (DAEs) , each supporting a maximum of 120 2.5" drives.
Software available in simple ordering options: F/FX for open systems, zF/zFx for mainframe

span.p: An initial 53 TBu v-Brick/z-Brick configuration can be:

ul.li: Scaled up by adding 13TB flash capacity (open systems)/zCapacity (mainframe) packs that bundle all required storage capacity and software
Scaled out by adding v-Bricks/z-Bricks to increase performance, connectivity, and throughput.

span.p: Independent and linear scaling of both capacity and performance makes the VMAX 850F arrays extremely flexible at addressing varying workloads.
